1.text: Wine is a mocker, strong drink a brawler; and whosoever erreth thereby is not wise.

2.text: The terror of a king is as the roaring of a lion: he that provoketh him to anger sinneth against his own life.

3.text: It is an honour for a man to keep aloof from strife: but every fool will be quarrelling.

4.text: The slothful will not plow by reason of the winter; therefore he shall beg in harvest, and have nothing.

5.text: Counsel in the heart of man is like deep water; but a man of understanding will draw it out.

6.text: Most men wilt proclaim every one his own kindness: but a faithful man who can find?

7.text: A just man that walketh in his integrity, blessed are his children after him.

8.text: A king that sitteth on the throne of judgment scattereth away all evil with his eyes.

9.text: Who can say, I have made my heart clean, I am pure from my sin?

10.text: Divers weights, and divers measures, both of them alike are an abomination to the LORD.

11.text: Even a child maketh himself known by his doings, whether his work be pure, and whether it be right.

12.text: The hearing ear, and the seeing eye, the LORD hath made even both of them.

13.text: Love not sleep, lest thou come to poverty; open thine eyes, and thou shalt be satisfied with bread.

14.text: It is naught, it is naught, saith the buyer: but when he is gone his way, then he boasteth.

15.text: There is gold, and abundance of rubies: but the lips of knowledge are a precious jewel.

16.text: Take his garment that is surety for a stranger; and hold him in pledge that is surety for strangers.

17.text: Bread of falsehood is sweet to a man; but afterwards his mouth shall be filled with gravel.

18.text: Every purpose is established by counsel: and by wise guidance make thou war,

19.text: He that goeth about as a talebearer revealeth secrets: therefore meddle not with him that openeth wide his lips.

20.text: Whoso curseth his father or his mother, his lamp shall be put out in the blackest darkness.

21.text: An inheritance may be gotten hastily at the beginning; but the end thereof shall not be blessed.

22.text: Say not thou, I will recompense evil: wait on the LORD, and he shall save thee.

23.text: Divers weights are an abomination to the LORD; and a false balance is not good.

24.text: A manâ€™s goings are of the LORD; how then can man understand his way?

25.text: It is a snare to a man rashly to say, It is holy, and after vows to make inquiry.

26.text: A wise king winnoweth the wicked, and bringeth the threshing wheel over them.

27.text: The spirit of man is the lamp of the LORD, searching all the innermost parts of the belly.

28.text: Mercy and truth preserve the king: and his throne is upholden by mercy.

29.text: The glory of young men is their strength: and the beauty of old men is the hoary head.

30.text: Stripes that wound cleanse away evil: and strokes reach the innermost parts of the belly.
